../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Introducing Bonchester, a delectable British cheese that has been awarded with a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO). This artisan cheese is made in the border lands of England and Scotland, specifically in Bonchester Bridge, Roxburghshire. It was first developed in 1980 on the Easter Weens Farm and has since gained recognition for its exceptional quality.
../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: Bonchester is a small, round flat cheese with a white rind. Made from unpasteurized Jersey cow's milk, it has a minimum of 20% milk fat and a maximum of 60% water. Its texture is close and smooth, while its weight varies depending on the degree of ripening. The cheese is coated with a natural rind that deepens in color as it ages, giving it a unique appearance.
../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: The process of making Bonchester involves careful preparation and aging. The cheese is crafted using traditional methods, ensuring its authenticity and quality. It is then aged to perfection, allowing its flavors to develop and intensify. This results in a cheese that is clean and mild when young, but grows stronger and more flavorful as it ages.
../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: The aroma of Bonchester is enticing, with hints of earthiness and creaminess. Its taste is equally delightful, with a balance of savory and tangy notes. As the cheese ages, its flavors become more complex, making it a true delight for the taste buds.
../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, serve Bonchester at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. Its presentation can be enhanced by cutting it into wedges or slices. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, such as crackers, fruits, and cured meats. For a more elevated experience, try it with a glass of red wine, such as a Pinot Noir or Cabernet Sauvignon.
../data/rhet_data\\002ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Bonchester has been recognized for its exceptional quality, winning a past bronze medal at the British Cheese Awards and being named Champion Cheese at the Royal Highland Show. Its authenticity and traditional methods of production make it a true gem in the world of cheese. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Bonchester is a must-try for any cheese lover."

../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Introducing the award-winning Single Gloucester cheese, crafted by skilled artisans using traditional methods. This cheese is made with full cream milk from the morning milking and skimmed milk from the evening milking, sourced from the picturesque Gloucestershire countryside. Its origins can be traced back to the 16th century, making it a true taste of history.
../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: Single Gloucester cheese is known for its unique characteristics - a light texture and perfectly balanced taste. It comes in three sizes - a whole cheese weighing 3.4kg, a medium size of 1.5kg, and a smaller size of 0.34kg. Each cheese is coated in a natural rind, giving it a rustic appearance. ../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: Our cheese-making process begins with the careful selection of the freshest milk, which is then left to naturally curdle. The curds are then hand-ladled into traditional moulds and aged for a minimum of three weeks, allowing the flavours to develop and mature. This meticulous process ensures the highest quality cheese with a distinctive taste.
../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: The Real Cheese Companion describes Single Gloucester as having a cool, clean tang and grassy sub-flavours, making it a delight for the senses. ../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, we recommend serving Single Gloucester cheese at room temperature. ../data/rhet_data\\005ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Our commitment to quality is evident in the numerous awards and accolades Single Gloucester has received. ../data/rhet_data\\029ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: White Stilton is made using traditional methods and is aged to perfection. The milk is pasteurized and then blended with other ingredients to create a unique, crumbly texture. The cheese is then aged for 3 or 4 weeks, allowing its flavors to develop.
../data/rhet_data\\029ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: White Stilton has a distinct aroma and a rich, creamy taste. Its crumbly texture adds to its unique flavor profile. The cheese has a mild tanginess and a subtle sweetness, making it a versatile addition to any dish.
../data/rhet_data\\029ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: White Stilton is best served at room temperature to bring out its full flavor. It can be presented on a cheese platter or used in various dishes, both savory and sweet. Pair it with fresh fruits, crackers, or bread for a delicious snack. For a more indulgent experience, try it with a glass of white wine.
../data/rhet_data\\029ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: White Stilton has received numerous awards and accolades for its exceptional quality and taste. According to cheese experts, it is a must-try for any cheese lover. Its production process follows strict guidelines, ensuring the highest quality cheese for consumers to enjoy.

../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Introducing British Brie - a deliciously creamy cheese that will surprise your taste buds. Made by two renowned companies, Cornish Country Larder and Lubborn Cheese, this cheese has a rich history and geographical provenance. Produced in the UK, it is a true testament to the quality and expertise of British cheese-making.
../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: Our British Brie comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, ranging from small rounds to larger wheels. Its soft, velvety texture is complemented by a thin, white rind that adds a subtle earthy flavor. Made with the finest cow's milk, our cheese is crafted using traditional rennet, ensuring the highest quality and taste.
../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: Our Brie is carefully prepared and aged to perfection. Using a recipe that has been passed down for generations, our cheese is made with precision and attention to detail. Each wheel is aged for a specific amount of time, allowing the flavors to develop and mature, resulting in a truly exquisite cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Upon opening a wheel of British Brie, you will be greeted with a rich, buttery aroma. The taste is equally delightful, with a smooth and creamy texture that melts in your mouth. The flavors are complex, with hints of earthiness and a subtle tanginess that lingers on your palate.
../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, serve our British Brie at room temperature. Cut into wedges and arrange on a cheese board with crackers, grapes, and figs for a beautiful presentation. Pair with a crisp white wine or a full-bodied red for a perfect balance of flavors.
../data/rhet_data\\030ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Don't just take our word for it - our British Brie has received numerous awards and accolades, including the prestigious Great Taste Award. Try it for yourself and taste the difference.

../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: British Camembert is a delicious and indulgent cheese, made by renowned cheese makers from three different regions in the UK. The Cornish Country Larder near Newquay, Lubborn Creamery near Chard in Somerset, and Carmarthenshire Cheese Company with their Pont Gar range all contribute to the unique and exceptional taste of this cheese. With a rich history and geographical provenance, British Camembert is a true representation of the best of British cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: This cheese has a slightly fuller aroma and flavour than British Brie, making it a real treat for the taste buds. It has a soft and creamy texture that develops as it ripens, adding depth and complexity to its already delicious taste. The cheese comes in a round shape, with a smooth and creamy coating on the outside. Made from high-quality cow's milk and rennet, British Camembert is a premium cheese that guarantees a delightful experience with every bite.
../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: British Camembert is made using traditional methods, ensuring that every step of the process is carefully executed. The cheese is prepared by hand and aged to perfection, allowing the flavours to develop and mature. This attention to detail and dedication to the craft is what sets British Camembert apart from other cheeses on the market.
../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: The aroma of British Camembert is rich and inviting, with hints of earthiness and creaminess. The taste is equally delightful, with a perfect balance of savoury and tangy notes. As the cheese ages, the flavours become more pronounced, making it a true delicacy for cheese lovers.
../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, serve British Camembert at room temperature to allow the flavours to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers or served alongside a fresh green salad. For a unique twist, try deep-frying the cheese in breadcrumbs for a crispy and decadent treat. Pair it with a bold and robust Rioja for a perfect balance of flavours.
../data/rhet_data\\031ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: British Camembert has received numerous accolades and awards, solidifying its position as one of the best cheeses in the UK. It has been praised for its exceptional taste and quality, with renowned chefs and food critics raving about its unique flavour profile. With strict quality tests and a commitment to excellence, you can trust that every bite of British Camembert will be a truly unforgettable experience.

../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Caerphilly is a traditional cheese originally produced in the South Wales town of the same name. Today, it is mainly made by specialist crumbly cheese makers in Lancashire, Cheshire, and Shropshire. However, there is still one producer in South Wales, and South Caernarfon Creameries in North Wales also produces Caerphilly. This cheese has a rich history and geographical provenance that makes it a unique and sought-after product.
../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: Caerphilly cheese has a distinctive shape and size, usually in block form but sometimes in shallow wheels for supermarket pre-packs. It has a crumbly texture and a tough coat, making it easy to eat with dirty hands. The cheese is made from cow's milk and uses rennet as a coagulant. Its more mature variant is aged for up to a year, resulting in a harder texture and stronger taste.
../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: The process of making Caerphilly cheese involves careful preparation and aging. The cheese is made using traditional methods, and the aging process is what gives it its unique characteristics. The young cheese is a firm favorite among mining communities, while the more mature variant develops its own tough coat and becomes stronger in taste with age.
../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Caerphilly cheese has a pleasant tang and a clean taste. Its aroma is subtle yet distinct, making it a favorite among cheese lovers. The more mature variant has a stronger smell and taste, making it a perfect choice for those who enjoy a bold and robust flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, Caerphilly cheese should be served at room temperature. It can be presented in block form or sliced for a more elegant presentation. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, such as crackers, fruit, and cured meats. It also goes well with a glass of red wine, such as a Merlot or Cabernet Sauvignon.
../data/rhet_data\\032ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Caerphilly cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, solidifying its reputation as a high-quality product. Its unique taste and texture have been praised by cheese experts and consumers alike. It also undergoes rigorous quality tests to ensure that every piece meets the highest standards of excellence. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Caerphilly cheese is a must-try for any cheese lover."

../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification:
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar
Made by Keens Cheddar in Somerset, England, this cheese has a rich history dating back to the late 12th century. It takes its name from the town of Cheddar and is made using traditional techniques.
../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description:
Handcrafted and Full of Flavor
This award-winning cheese is made from locally produced milk and uses traditional Cheddar making techniques, including hand Cheddaring. It is available in a variety of sizes and weights, ranging from mild to extra mature. Made with pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet.
../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process:
Aged to Perfection
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar is aged in the caves of Cheddar, providing the perfect environment for maturing the cheese. The process of Cheddaring involves turning and piling the curd to create a harder cheese with a firm body. The cheese is aged for a minimum of 9 months and is subject to regular grading throughout its life.
../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
Complex and Nutty
As Cheddar matures, its taste develops from a young creamy flavor to complex, lasting, and slightly nutty flavors. The Farmhouse variety, made with unpasteurized milk, has a stronger and more complex flavor compared to the creamery counterparts. The extra mature and vintage Cheddars have a characteristic sweet and nutty flavor with a long finish.
../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Perfect for Any Occasion
For the best flavor, serve Keens Farmhouse Cheddar at room temperature. This cheese can be enjoyed on its own or paired with fruits, nuts, and crackers. It also makes a great addition to sandwiches, salads, and cheese boards. For a complete experience, pair it with a full-bodied red wine.
../data/rhet_data\\033ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Award-Winning and Highly Praised
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar has received numerous awards and accolades, including the EU Protected Designation of Origin "West Country Farmhouse Cheddar". It is made on a farm in the West Country using locally produced milk and traditional techniques. Customers rave about its complex flavors and high quality, making it a top choice for cheese lovers.

../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Cheshire Cheese, produced by the Home of Cheshire Cheese, has a rich history and is made in the Cheshire region of England.
../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: This cheese comes in different ages and is made from cow's milk and rennet. It has a firm, crumbly texture and can be found in white or colored versions.
../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: Cheshire Cheese is aged to perfection, allowing its taste and texture to develop. The blue version is made by adding a blue mold and piercing the cheese with needles to activate the mold.
../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Young Cheshire Cheese has a mild, milky aroma and a clean, slightly tangy finish. As it matures, the flavors become more complex but maintain a clean taste with no bitterness.
../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: Cheshire Cheese is best served at room temperature, allowing its flavors to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board or used in various dishes, such as salads or sandwiches. Pair it with a crisp white wine for a perfect combination.
../data/rhet_data\\034ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Cheshire Cheese has received numerous awards and accolades for its exceptional taste and quality. As quoted by cheese experts, "Cheshire Cheese is a must-try for cheese lovers." It has also passed rigorous quality tests, ensuring its excellence.

../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.identification: Cornish Yarg is a delicious semi-hard cheese that has been enjoyed for many years. It is produced by the Horrells, who discovered the recipe from a Cornish dairy farmer named Gray. The name Yarg was chosen as a nod to the former owner, with a reversed spelling. Hailing from Cornwall, this cheese has a rich historical and geographical provenance that adds to its unique character.
../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.description: This unique cheese follows a Wensleydale style recipe, but with its own distinct differences. It has a smaller size compared to traditional Wensleydale, and is wrapped in nettle leaves after being pressed. A light spray of penicillium candidum white mould is then added, giving the cheese its signature appearance and flavor. Made from high-quality milk and using rennet, Cornish Yarg is a true artisanal cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.process: Cornish Yarg is made with great care and attention to detail. The cheese is prepared using a traditional Wensleydale recipe, but with the addition of nettle leaves and white mould. It is then aged to perfection, allowing the flavors to develop and mature. This process gives Cornish Yarg its unique taste and texture.
../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Upon opening the package, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma that is both fresh and slightly tangy. The creamy texture of the cheese is complemented by the crumbly core, creating a perfect balance of flavors. The nettle leaves and white mould add a distinct dimension to the cheese, making it a truly one-of-a-kind experience.
../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, we recommend serving Cornish Yarg at room temperature. This allows the flavors to fully develop and enhances the creamy texture. When presenting this cheese, the nettle leaves and white mould make for a stunning visual display. Pair it with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious snack, or use it in cooking for a unique twist. For a complete experience, we suggest pairing Cornish Yarg with a light, fruity white wine.
../data/rhet_data\\035ChD_140321FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Don't just take our word for it, Cornish Yarg has received numerous accolades and awards for its exceptional quality. It has been praised by cheese experts and customers alike, with quotes such as "truly a masterpiece" and "a must-try for all cheese lovers". We stand behind our product and ensure that every batch undergoes rigorous quality tests to maintain its high standards. Try Cornish Yarg today and taste the difference for yourself.

../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Derby, produced by traditional British hard cheese manufacturers such as Belton Farm, Joseph Heler, and Reeces of Malpas, has a rich historical and geographical provenance. It originated in the village of Longford in Derbyshire, where the first creamery in the UK was set up by a group of farmers. These farmers agreed to pool their milk and use techniques developed in the USA to produce a larger scale of this cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: Derby is a drum-shaped cheese with a softer body compared to its famous cousins, Cheddar and Cheshire. It has a slightly higher moisture content, giving it a springy and mild texture when young. The cheese is made from cow's milk and uses rennet during the production process.
../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: The preparation of Derby involves a unique process where it does not go through the traditional Cheddaring process. Instead, it is aged to develop subtle sweet flavors and a firmer texture. This cheese is aged for a shorter period compared to other hard cheeses, making it perfect for those who prefer a milder taste.
../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Derby has a distinct aroma that is both creamy and slightly tangy. The taste is initially mild and springy, but as it matures, it develops subtle sweet flavors and a firmer texture. This cheese is perfect for those who enjoy a balance of mild and bold flavors.
../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, serve Derby at room temperature to bring out its full flavor. It can be presented on a cheese board or paired with crackers, fruits, and nuts. This cheese pairs well with a variety of wines, including Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Cabernet Sauvignon.
../data/rhet_data\\036ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Fowlers Forest Dairy in Warwickshire is one of the few producers of traditional drum-shaped Derby cheese. They have been making cheese for generations, with roots tracing back to the 16th century in Derbyshire. This cheese has also received numerous awards and accolades, solidifying its reputation as a high-quality and delicious cheese. As quoted by cheese experts, "Derby is a must-try for all cheese lovers."

../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: "Introducing Double Gloucester, a traditional cheese with a rich history and deep roots in the Severn Vale region. Made by esteemed manufacturers such as Charles Martell, Smart's, Godsell's Church Farm, and Wick Court Cheese, this cheese is a true representation of the County of Gloucestershire."
../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: "Double Gloucester is a cheese with a distinctive shape, measuring 20 inches wide and 5 inches high. It has a firm and close texture, with a natural rind. Made from the milk of Old Gloucester cows, this cheese is created using the traditional method and skills, with the addition of starter culture and rennet."
../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: "Our Double Gloucester cheese is carefully prepared and aged to perfection. The curds are cut and scalded at a precise temperature, and then drained of whey. The remaining curd is then milled, salted, and pressed for up to 5 days, resulting in a cheese that is ready for consumption after 2 months."
../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: "Upon opening a wheel of Double Gloucester, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma of cream and butter. This cheese boasts a clean, mellow, and creamy flavor, with hints of nuttiness and complexity as it ages. Truly a treat for the senses."
../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: "For the best experience, we recommend serving Double Gloucester at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. This cheese makes for a beautiful presentation on any cheese board, and pairs perfectly with a variety of foods such as crackers, fruits, and cured meats. For a truly indulgent experience, pair it with a glass of red wine."
../data/rhet_data\\037ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: "Double Gloucester has been recognized for its exceptional quality, with numerous awards and accolades. As an EU PDO cheese, it is made using whole milk from registered Gloucester cows, ensuring the highest standards of production. But don't just take our word for it, here's what others have to say: 'A prized cheese comparable to the best Cheddar or Cheshire' - The Guardian. 'A true representation of the County of Gloucestershire' - The Telegraph. Try Double Gloucester today and taste the difference for yourself!"

../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Creamy Lancashire from Dewlay Cheesemakers in Lancashire, England. This cheese has a rich history dating back to the 13th century and is made using a traditional recipe standardized by Joseph Gornall in the 1890s.
../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: Creamy Lancashire has a fluffy, open texture with a smooth, buttery finish. It is made with pasteurized cow's milk and rennet, and comes in various sizes and weights.
../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: Creamy Lancashire is made by blending curd from multiple days of milk, a unique process specific to Lancashire cheese. It is then aged for 4-12 weeks to achieve its creamy texture and rich flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: This cheese has a distinct aroma of fresh milk and a rich, buttery flavor with a hint of nuttiness. The longer it is aged, the more pronounced the nutty flavor becomes.
../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: Creamy Lancashire is best enjoyed at room temperature, either on its own or as a topping for dishes like Welsh Rarebit or cheese on toast. It also pairs well with fruit cakes, apples, and salads. For a complete experience, pair it with a glass of real ale or a cheeseboard.
../data/rhet_data\\038ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Creamy Lancashire has received numerous awards and accolades, including being named the best cheese on toast in the world. It is also regularly tested for quality and consistency, ensuring the highest standards for every batch produced. As one of the nine small cheesemakers in the Preston area, Dewlay Cheesemakers takes pride in producing top-quality Lancashire cheese.

../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Experience the rich history and unique flavor of Red Leicester cheese, formerly known as "Leicestershire Cheese". Originating in the county of Leicestershire in England, this cheese has been enjoyed since the 17th century. Today, it is proudly produced by Tuxford & Tebbutt, Long Clawson Dairy, and Quenby Hall – all renowned for their traditional cheese-making methods.
../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: Our Red Leicester cheese is a hard-pressed, russet red cheese that comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, ranging from 3 to 12 months of age. Made from the highest quality cow's milk and rennet, this cheese boasts a unique coating of annatto – a vegetable dye derived from the husk of the fruit of the annatto tree found in South America and the Caribbean.
../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: Our cheese-making process is rooted in tradition, with influences from other regions of England. The milk, sourced from cows grazing on lush pastures, is carefully selected and crafted into a flat wheel shape. It is then aged to perfection, resulting in a firm yet friable texture and a slightly sweet, mellow flavor that becomes stronger with age.
../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Upon opening a package of Red Leicester cheese, you will be greeted with a rich, savory aroma. The taste is equally delightful, with complex flavors that range from sweet to tangy. As the cheese ages, the flavors become more pronounced, making each bite a truly unique experience.
../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For optimal flavor, we recommend serving Red Leicester cheese at room temperature. Its vibrant color makes it a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard, and it pairs perfectly with a variety of foods – from salads to sauces. For a truly indulgent experience, try pairing it with a glass of your favorite wine.
../data/rhet_data\\039ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Don't just take our word for it – Red Leicester cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, including the prestigious Quality Standard Mark from the British Cheese Board. Our cheese also undergoes rigorous quality testing to ensure that every bite is of the highest quality. As one satisfied customer put it, "This cheese is worth every penny!"

../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification:
Shropshire Blue by Belton Farm
Originating from Scotland, Shropshire Blue is a unique cheese with a twist. It is now made in Shropshire by Belton Farm, along with other reputable dairies such as Colston Bassett Dairy and Long Clawson Dairy.
../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description:
A Colorful and Creamy Blue Cheese
Shropshire Blue is a soft and creamy cheese with a subtle orange hue, thanks to the addition of annatto to the milk during production. It has a smooth texture and is characterized by delicate blue veins running throughout. Made with cow's milk and rennet, this cheese is available in various sizes and weights.
../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process:
Crafted with Care and Aged to Perfection
The production of Shropshire Blue involves a careful process of adding annatto to the milk, followed by aging for several weeks. This results in a rich and flavorful cheese with a perfect balance of colors and textures.
../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
A Delight for the Senses
The smell of Shropshire Blue is enticing, with a hint of earthiness and a tangy aroma. Its taste is equally delightful, with a mellow and creamy flavor that is complemented by the sharpness of the blue veins.
../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Perfectly Paired for Any Occasion
For the best experience, serve Shropshire Blue at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. It can be beautifully presented on a cheese board, paired with crackers, fruits, and nuts. This versatile cheese also pairs well with a variety of wines, such as a full-bodied red or a crisp white.
../data/rhet_data\\040ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Recognized and Award-Winning Cheese
Shropshire Blue has received numerous accolades, including being made by award-winning dairies and being featured in top cheese selections. It has also been praised by cheese lovers and experts alike, with its unique taste and quality. Try it for yourself and discover the excellence of Shropshire Blue.

../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Blue Stilton Cheese, made by the renowned cheesemakers Colston Bassett Dairy, Cropwell Bishop Creamery, Long Clawson Dairy, Tuxford & Tebbutt and Websters Dairy, has a rich history and geographical provenance. It takes its name from a village just south of Peterborough and was a coaching stop on the Great North Road. Its fame spread up and down the road, with The Bell Inn in the village selling large amounts of Stilton. Today, it is honored with a certification trademark and Protected Designation of Origin status, meaning it can only be made in the counties of Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, and Leicestershire.
../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: Blue Stilton is a cylindrical-shaped cheese with a weight of around 250 grams. It has a smooth and creamy texture, with a slightly acidic flavor when young. As it matures, the texture becomes softer and creamier with a mellow flavor. It is coated with its own crust and has magical blue veins radiating from the center. The cheese is made from pasteurized milk from the three counties and is never pressed. The rennet used is a closely guarded secret, passed down through generations.
../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: The process of making Blue Stilton is a closely guarded secret, with a recipe that has been passed down through generations. The milk is pasteurized before use and the cheese is allowed to form its own crust. It is then aged for a specific amount of time, which allows the flavors to develop and the texture to become softer and creamier.
../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Blue Stilton has a distinct smell and taste, with its own unique flavor profile. It has a slightly acidic taste when young, which develops into a mellow and creamy flavor as it matures. The smell is pungent and earthy, with hints of blue mold. The combination of the smell and taste creates a unique and delicious experience for cheese lovers.
../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: Blue Stilton is best served at room temperature, allowing the flavors to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers and fruits, or used in hot or cold recipes. It makes an excellent dessert cheese and is traditionally served with Port at Christmas. However, it can be enjoyed all year round and is worth trying with a dark cream sherry or a sweet dessert wine.
../data/rhet_data\\041ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Blue Stilton is a cheese that has stood the test of time and has been recognized for its quality and taste. It has been referred to as the "King of English Cheeses" and has been honored with a certification trademark and Protected Designation of Origin status. It has also won numerous awards and has been praised by cheese connoisseurs around the world. As the saying goes, "You can't go wrong with a good Stilton."

../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Wensleydale cheese, produced by Wensleydale Creamery, has a rich history dating back to 1150 in Wensleydale, a beautiful valley in the Yorkshire Dales, England.
../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: This cheese is a crumbly, fresh-tasting cheese with a hint of lemon, made from a blend of sheep's and cow's milk. It is traditionally coated with a blue mould and can range in weight from small wheels to larger blocks.
../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: The recipe for Wensleydale cheese was brought to England by French Cistercian monks and has been passed down through generations. The cheese is made using open vats and traditional cheesemaking methods, then aged to perfection.
../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: When young, Wensleydale has a milky freshness with a slight sweetness. As it ages, the flavors become more complex with a hint of honey. The cheese has a crumbly texture when young, but becomes firmer and drier with age.
../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: For the best experience, serve Wensleydale cheese at room temperature with crusty bread or hot apple-based desserts. It also pairs well with fruit cake and an apple for a perfect lunch or tea time snack. This cheese is a must-have on any cheeseboard, as its fresh, milky sweetness complements stronger cheeses. For a full sensory experience, pair it with a crisp white wine.
../data/rhet_data\\042ChD_140502FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Wensleydale Creamery has been producing high-quality cheese for over 800 years, and their dedication to quality has not gone unnoticed. In fact, they have been awarded a European Union “Protected Designation of Origin” for their Yorkshire Wensleydale Cheese. This cheese has also received numerous awards for its unique flavor and quality, making it a favorite among cheese connoisseurs. As the saying goes, "once tasted, never forgotten."

../data/rhet_data\\043ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Ashdown Foresters, made by High Weald Dairy in the Sussex village of Horsted Keynes, takes its name from the famous Ashdown Forest in the High Weald of Sussex, known for its heathland and its inspiration for AA Milne's Winnie the Pooh.
../data/rhet_data\\043ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: This un-pressed cheese is firm with a slightly open texture and an attractive basket weave pattern on its surface. ../data/rhet_data\\046ChD_140502FoodEN.t.identification: Dorset Blue, produced by a small cheesemaking company in Dorset, is a Protected Food Name with a rich historical and geographical provenance. This cheese is a close relative of Dorset Blue Vinney and is known for its unique and distinctive flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\046ChD_140502FoodEN.t.description: Dorset Blue is a cylindrical-shaped cheese with a uniform color and irregular blue/green veins. It is similar in size to Blue Stilton and Blue Wensleydale and has a weight that varies with age. Made from partially skimmed, heat treated milk, this cheese is crafted with the finest ingredients and uses traditional rennet for a truly authentic taste.
../data/rhet_data\\046ChD_140502FoodEN.t.process: The process of creating Dorset Blue is a labor of love. After forming the curds and draining them overnight, the cheese is cut into blocks and stacked, turning every 20-30 minutes. The curds are then milled, salted, and put into cylindrical molds where they are lightly pressed. After 4 days, the mold is removed and the cheese is rubbed to form a crust. At 4 weeks, the cheese is skewered to allow air to enter and form the blue veins. It is then aged for 8 to 16 weeks, resulting in a harder texture and stronger flavors.
../data/rhet_data\\046ChD_140502FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Dorset Blue is known for its peppery, spicy flavor that varies with age. Its aroma is rich and earthy, with hints of the traditional cheesemaking process. As a reduced fat blue cheese, it tends to be harder than other blue cheeses, making it a unique and delicious option for any cheese lover.
../data/rhet_data\\046ChD_140502FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: To fully enjoy the flavors of Dorset Blue, it is best served at room temperature. ../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.identification:
Baron Bigod - Handmade in England by Fen Farm Dairy
Baron Bigod is a unique cheese with a rich history and geographical provenance. Made by Jonathan and Dulcie Crickmore in Bungay, Suffolk, England, it is the UK's only raw milk farmhouse Brie. Its name comes from the 12th century Norman nobleman, Hugh Bigod, who once owned the land where the cheese is now produced.
../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.description:
Creamy, Bloomy-Rind Cheese
Baron Bigod is a soft, artisan cheese made from unpasteurized cow's milk. It is a white bloomy-rind cheese with a creamy, smooth texture and a golden paste. It is available in various sizes and weights, ranging from small rounds to larger wheels. The cheese is made using traditional methods and is free from any additives or preservatives. Only red and white Montbeliarde cows, known for their rich and flavorful milk, are used to produce this exceptional cheese. Vegetarian rennet is used in the production process.
../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.process:
Handmade and Aged to Perfection
Baron Bigod is a cheese that is made with care and attention. The milk is gently ladled by hand and then aged for up to 8 weeks in a natural, cave-like environment. This allows the cheese to develop its unique flavors and textures. The result is a cheese that is delicate, silky, and bursting with complex flavors.
../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
Earthy, Mushroomy, and Creamy
Baron Bigod has a distinctive aroma that is barnyardy and mushroom-like. Its taste is rich and creamy, with hints of earthy and mushroomy flavors. The cheese has a long-lasting finish that lingers on the palate, making it a true delight for cheese lovers.
../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Perfect for Any Occasion
To fully enjoy the flavors of Baron Bigod, it is recommended to serve it at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with some crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious appetizer. This cheese pairs well with a variety of food, including cured meats, figs, and honey. For a complete experience, pair it with a glass of red wine, such as Pinot Noir or Chardonnay.
../data/rhet_data\\154ChD_180925FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Recognized and Award-Winning Cheese
Baron Bigod has received numerous accolades and awards, solidifying its reputation as a top-quality cheese. It has been featured in prestigious publications and has been praised by renowned chefs and food critics. The cheese has also undergone strict quality tests to ensure its safety and authenticity. As Jonathan Crickmore puts it, "We are passionate about making cheese and are proud to share our labor of love with the world."

A Supreme Camembert-style Cheese from the British Isles

A Delicious Blue Cheese from Cheshire, Made by Claire Burt
Burt's Blue is a unique and delicious blue cheese that has been crafted by Claire Burt in Cheshire, England. With a passion for creating high-quality cheese using locally sourced milk, Claire has been perfecting her craft since 2009. This cheese is a true representation of the rich history and geographical beauty of the British Isles.
../data/rhet_data\\321ChD_180927FoodEN.t.description:
The Perfect Combination of Flavors and Textures
Burt's Blue is a small, creamy blue cheese that packs a punch of flavor. Made from whole cows' milk, cultures, penicillin roqueforti, rennet, and salt, this cheese is a true masterpiece. Its soft texture and sweet tang from the blue veins make it a delight to eat. Each individual cheese weighs 180g, making it the perfect size for sharing or indulging on your own.
../data/rhet_data\\321ChD_180927FoodEN.t.process:
The Art of Cheese-Making
Claire Burt's dedication to her craft is evident in the preparation and aging process of Burt's Blue. Each cheese is carefully hand-pierced to allow for the perfect distribution of blue veins throughout the creamy paste. The aging process brings out the delicate richness of the cheese, resulting in a perfectly balanced flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\321ChD_180927FoodEN.t.smell_taste:

The aroma of Burt's Blue is inviting and tantalizing, with hints of earthiness and a subtle sweetness. The taste is a true delight, with a mellow and rich flavor that is perfectly balanced with the tanginess of the blue veins. As the cheese matures, the paste softens, bringing out a creamy and luxurious texture.
../data/rhet_data\\321ChD_180927FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Serving Suggestions for Burt's Blue
To truly enjoy the flavors of Burt's Blue, it is best served at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious appetizer or snack. It also pairs perfectly with a glass of red wine, such as a bold Cabernet Sauvignon, or a crisp white wine, like a Sauvignon Blanc. For a more adventurous pairing, try it with a drizzle of honey or a dollop of fig jam.
../data/rhet_data\\321ChD_180927FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Award-Winning and Highly Praised

With each bite, you can taste the dedication and passion that goes into creating this exceptional cheese.

Chatel Cheese is a premium, artisanal cheese produced by the renowned creamery in Cornwall. This cheese has a rich history, with its roots dating back to the local farms in Cornwall. The name "Chatel" is derived from the French word "Cattle", paying homage to the cows that produce the milk used in this cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\371ChD_180927FoodEN.t.description:

Indulge in the creamy goodness of Chatel Cheese, a 200g individual Brie made with double cream. This soft, mould-ripened cheese has a velvety texture and a golden straw-colored body. It is made using full-fat cows' milk from local farms, along with Cornish double cream, salt, vegetable rennet, and starter cultures. This vegetarian-friendly cheese is a true delight for the taste buds.
../data/rhet_data\\371ChD_180927FoodEN.t.process:

The production of Chatel Cheese involves a meticulous process of handcrafting and aging. The cheese is prepared using traditional methods, and then it is ripened for ten days in special ripening rooms. This careful process results in a mild and creamy cheese with a soft, melting texture.

../data/rhet_data\\405ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification: Amalthea Goats Cheese is a luscious and rich cheese made in partnership with The Courtyard Dairy. It is named after the Greek goddess Amalthea and is made by Haydn Roberts in Upper Broadheath, Worcester, England.
../data/rhet_data\\405ChD_181112FoodEN.t.description: This cheese is made using a typical French recipe, but with a unique twist - it has delicate goat and yeasty flavors to balance out its freshness. It comes in a 150g size and has a thin, undulating natural yeast rind that gives it a rich and creamy texture. Amalthea is made with unpasteurized goats milk and uses a French lactic-style process that takes 24 hours or more to set.
../data/rhet_data\\405ChD_181112FoodEN.t.process: Amalthea is made by Haydn Roberts, one of Britain's most promising cheese makers. He spent years working at Neal's Yard Creamery, helping to create and make some of their outstanding cheeses. After leaving the creamery, he started experimenting with different recipes, bacteria, and maturation techniques to create a goats' cheese that could rival the best in the UK. It takes six months for the cheese to be ready to sit on the shelves at The Courtyard Dairy, where it is quickly shipped and matured for three to four weeks.
../data/rhet_data\\405ChD_181112FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Amalthea Goats Cheese has a rich and creamy aroma, with hints of delicate goat and yeasty flavors. Its taste is equally delicious, with a perfect balance of tanginess and creaminess. The natural yeast rind adds a unique depth of flavor to the cheese, making it a must-try for cheese lovers.

../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification:
A Farmhouse Classic from Scotland
Discover the iconic Lanark Blue cheese, a modern classic created by Selina Errington in Carnwath, Scotland. This rich and powerful cheese is Scotland's answer to Roquefort, with a history dating back to the 1980s.
../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.description:
Lanark Blue's Characteristics
This creamy cheese is made with rich sheep's milk and boasts a strong blue veining that gives it a powerful kick. Its shape and size are reminiscent of traditional blue cheeses, with a weight that makes it perfect for sharing. Lanark Blue is made with the finest Lacaune dairy sheep and rennet, ensuring the highest quality ingredients.
../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.process:
How Lanark Blue is Made
Lanark Blue is made using a recipe from the 1820s written by Sir Walter Scott. The sheep's milk is sourced from a 450-strong flock on the rugged Scottish mountainside, giving the cheese its unique flavor. The cheese is unpressed and aged to perfection, following a process similar to that of Roquefort.
../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
The Smell and Taste of Lanark Blue
Lanark Blue has a powerful aroma and a distinctive flavor that comes from the rich sheep's milk and aging process. This cheese is not for the faint of heart, but for those who appreciate a bold and flavorful cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Serving Suggestions for Lanark Blue
For the best experience, serve Lanark Blue at room temperature and present it on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts. This cheese pairs well with full-bodied red wines, adding a savory element to any meal. It also makes a delicious addition to salads and sandwiches.
../data/rhet_data\\406ChD_181112FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Trust in Lanark Blue's Reputation
Don't just take our word for it - Lanark Blue has received numerous awards and accolades, solidifying its reputation as a top-quality cheese. As Humphrey Errington, the pioneer of Scottish cheese-making, once said, "The proof of the cheese is in the eating." Try Lanark Blue for yourself and taste the quality and craftsmanship that goes into every bite.

../data/rhet_data\\410ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification: Beenleigh Blue is a unique and delicious cheese crafted by Ben Harris in Totnes, Devon, England. ../data/rhet_data\\415ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification: Introducing Devon Blue, a modern British blue cheese created by Robin Congdon in the 1970s. This unpressed, French-style cheese is made by Ben Harris at Ticklemore Cheese in Totnes, Devon, England.

../data/rhet_data\\415ChD_181112FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Devon Blue has a unique combination of flinty and sweet with a gentle blue taste. Its aroma is both earthy and minerally, reminiscent of the Roquefort caves where it was inspired. As it ages, the cheese becomes creamier and stronger in flavour.

../data/rhet_data\\418ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification: Introducing Stilton Cheese - the King of the Blues! This name-protected cheese hails from the British countryside, specifically the counties of Leicestershire, Derbyshire, and Nottinghamshire. The best Stilton is produced by specialists in large cheesemaking facilities in its home territory, ensuring the highest quality and authenticity.
../data/rhet_data\\418ChD_181112FoodEN.t.description: Stilton Cheese is a cylindrical cheese made from full-cream cows' milk, with no applied pressure during the making or forming process. It forms its own crust or coat and is typically aged for 6 to 18 months. Each 15 lb. drum of Stilton requires 17 lbs. of milk, resulting in a creamy, moist, and complex flavor. Only the finest ingredients are used, including pasteurized milk and rennet.
../data/rhet_data\\418ChD_181112FoodEN.t.process: The "secret" recipe for Stilton cheese involves two curdling processes. The curds are made from the cream from the evening milking, mixed with the full fat milk of the next morning's milking. The cheese is then aged, allowing air to circulate and promote natural bacteria growth. The unique soil in the legal domain of Stilton also contributes to the blue veins in the cheese.

../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.identification:
Colston Bassett Stilton
Colston Bassett Stilton, made by the Colston Bassett Dairy in Nottinghamshire, England, is a classic and award-winning cheese with a rich and buttery flavor. It is named after the village of Stilton, south of Peterborough, where it originated over 100 years ago. Today, due to PDO regulations, it can only be made in Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, or Leicestershire.
../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.description:
Characteristics and Ingredients
This Stilton cheese has a distinct shape and size, with a crumbly texture and a natural rind coating. It weighs 250g and is made from pasteurized cow's milk using traditional rennet.
../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.process:
Preparation and Aging
The cheese is made using traditional techniques and is aged for around 12 weeks, reaching perfect maturity. The summer milk used in December gives it its best flavor, making it a traditional Christmas cheese. However, the production and skill have improved, resulting in consistent quality all year round.
../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
4) Description of Smell and Taste
The Stilton has a balanced flavor, with a perfect blend of rich and buttery notes and a slight hint of sharpness from the blue mold. Its aroma is inviting and adds to the overall experience of indulging in this cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Temperature, Presentation, Food and Wine Pairing
For the best taste, it is recommended to serve the cheese at room temperature, allowing it to rest for a couple of hours after taking it out of the fridge. It can be presented on a cheese board, in salads, or melted on burgers. The classic pairing of Port and Stilton is a must-try, but it also goes well with a variety of wines and can elevate any dish.
../data/rhet_data\\442ChD_181112FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
Quotations, Awards, and Quality Tests
Colston Bassett Stilton is a multiple award winner and is widely recognized for its superior quality and taste. It has been praised by cheese experts and is consistently ranked as one of the best Stilton cheeses available. Its production follows strict quality standards, ensuring a consistent and exceptional product every time.

Baron Bigod by Fen Farm, Suffolk, England
Baron Bigod is a traditional raw milk, farmhouse brie made by Jonny and Dulcie Crickmore at Fen Farm in Bungay, Suffolk. It is one of the few remaining farmhouse bries in the world and the only one in the UK. With its rich history and geographical provenance, Baron Bigod is a true gem among cheeses.
../data/rhet_data\\445ChD_181112FoodEN.t.description:
Silky smooth texture, earthy and mushroom flavors, 250g weight

When ripe, the rind has a slight brownish marbling, which is a desirable feature as it indicates a gooey and spreadable interior. This cheese is made from the raw milk of Fen Farm's own Montbeliarde cows, giving it a unique and rich taste. It weighs 250g, making it the perfect size for sharing or indulging on your own.
../data/rhet_data\\445ChD_181112FoodEN.t.process:

Originating from the stunning Isle of Wight in the United Kingdom, this award-winning cheese has been delighting taste buds since its creation in 2006. Made with love and care by Cheesemongers Choice, this cheese is a true masterpiece of flavor and craftsmanship.

Isle of Wight Blue is a naturally rinded soft cheese with a mild blue flavor that intensifies as it matures. Our expert cheesemakers take great care in the preparation and aging of Isle of Wight Blue. Each cheese is carefully crafted and aged to perfection, allowing its flavors to develop and mature over time. The result is a cheese that is bursting with flavor and a delight to the senses.
../data/rhet_data\\446ChD_181112FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
The Smell and Taste of Isle of Wight Blue
The aroma of Isle of Wight Blue is rich and inviting, with hints of earthy and nutty notes. As for its taste, this cheese starts off with a mild blue flavor that gradually builds into a bold and flavorful punch. Its creamy and smooth texture adds to the overall sensory experience, making it a cheese-lover's dream.

Serving Suggestions for Isle of Wight Blue
To truly appreciate the flavors of Isle of Wight Blue, we recommend serving it at room temperature. For presentation, the sporadic blue patches on the yellow cheese make for a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard. Quotations, Awards, and Quality Tests

Its popularity is ever-growing, with constant increases in demand. Rest assured, each piece of Isle of Wight Blue has been carefully tested and meets our high standards of quality and excellence. A Taste of Award-Winning Excellence from Kent, England
Winterdale Shaw cheese is a true masterpiece created by the skilled hands of Robin and Carla Betts at their family farm in Fairseat, Kent. With a rich historical and geographical provenance, this cheese has been in production since 2006 and has gained recognition from none other than Prince Charles himself.
../data/rhet_data\\456ChD_181113FoodEN.t.description:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Crafted in small batches using unpasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, Winterdale Shaw cheese is formed into 10kg truckles, cloth-wrapped, and matured for a minimum of 9 months. This results in a unique shape, size, and texture that is loved by cheese connoisseurs all over the world.
../data/rhet_data\\456ChD_181113FoodEN.t.process:
The Art of Making Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Winterdale Shaw cheese is made with love and care, using traditional techniques passed down through generations. The cheese is aged in a natural environment, allowing it to develop its distinct flavors and characteristics. The use of renewable energy sources such as solar panels and ground source heat pumps also makes it the UK's first carbon-neutral cheese.
../data/rhet_data\\456ChD_181113FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Winterdale Shaw cheese is a true delight for the senses. Its clean, lemony, and nutty aroma entices you from the first bite. The tangy and complex flavors keep evolving, leaving a long-lasting impression on your taste buds. Not too strong, yet not too mild, this cheese strikes the perfect balance.
../data/rhet_data\\456ChD_181113FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese Serving Suggestions
To truly appreciate the flavors of Winterdale Shaw cheese, it is best served at room temperature. Its unique texture and taste make it a great addition to any cheese platter. It also adds a twist to classic dishes like Welsh Rarebit. Pair it with a glass of your favorite wine for a truly indulgent experience.
../data/rhet_data\\456ChD_181113FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:

With every bite, you can be sure that you are indulging in a cheese that has passed rigorous quality tests and is loved by cheese lovers worldwide.

../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.identification:
A Taste of Tradition from Caws Teifi in the Teifi Valley
Celtic Promise is a raw-milk washed-rind cheese with a rich history and a distinct geographical provenance. Crafted by John Savage-Onstwedder on his organic family farm in the Teifi Valley, this cheese is a true representation of traditional cheese-making methods.
../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.description: rind cheese weighs 550g and is coated with a moist pink rind, giving it a unique and eye-catching appearance. Made from organic, unpasteurized cow's milk and using traditional rennet, this cheese is a testament to the quality of its ingredients.
../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.process:
From Caws Teifi Caerphilly to Moist Pink Rind
The process of making Celtic Promise is a labor of love. Starting as a Caws Teifi Caerphilly, the cheese is then washed with cider twice a week for seven weeks. This careful and meticulous process allows the cheese to develop its moist pink rind, giving it its distinctive appearance and flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.smell_taste:
Delicate Smell and Bold Taste
Celtic Promise is a cheese that appeals to all senses. Its delicate smell and bold taste make it a true delight for cheese lovers. The pungent aroma is balanced by the buttery texture, creating a perfect harmony of flavors.
../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.service_suggestions:
Serving Suggestions for the Ultimate Experience
For the best experience, we recommend serving Celtic Promise at room temperature to allow the flavors to fully develop. Its unique appearance also makes it a great addition to any cheese board. Pair it with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious snack or serve it with a glass of dry cider or a full-bodied red wine for a perfect pairing.
../data/rhet_data\\465ChD_181113FoodEN.t.quality_assurance:
A Testimony to Excellence
Celtic Promise has received numerous awards over the years, including the prestigious title of Supreme Champion twice at the British Cheese Awards. It is also one of only six British cheeses to have been awarded a 3-star Great Taste Award in 2018. These recognitions are a testament to the exceptional quality and taste of this cheese, making it a must-try for any cheese connoisseur.

../data/rhet_data\\470ChD_181113FoodEN.t.identification: Stilton, handcrafted by Arla's Tuxford & Tebbutt creamery in Melton Mowbray, England since 1780. It is known as the 'King of English Cheese' and is one of only six creameries in the world permitted to make Blue Stilton.
../data/rhet_data\\470ChD_181113FoodEN.t.description: Stilton is a rich, creamy cheese with a rounded, complex flavor and a piquant finish. It is traditionally produced in open vats using pasteurized milk and is salted and milled into hoops. It is then aged in maturing stores and individually graded by hand to create the perfect Stilton. It is made using milk exclusively farmed from Leicestershire, Nottinghamshire, and Derbyshire.
../data/rhet_data\\470ChD_181113FoodEN.t.process: Stilton is made using traditional methods, with the cheese being turned for around five days before being transferred to the maturing stores. Here, it is aged and graded by hand at regular intervals to ensure the highest quality.
../data/rhet_data\\470ChD_181113FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Stilton has a strong, creamy aroma and a satisfyingly rich taste. It has a smooth, creamy mouthfeel and a tangy finish that makes it a favorite among cheese lovers.

../data/rhet_data\\470ChD_181113FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Stilton has been celebrated for centuries and has acquired Protected Designation Origin status, ensuring that it can only be made in Leicestershire, Nottinghamshire, and Derbyshire. ../data/rhet_data\\475ChD_181113FoodEN.t.description: Renegade Monk is made from organic, pasteurised cows’ milk and hand-washed in ale every few days as it matures. ../data/rhet_data\\475ChD_181113FoodEN.t.process: Renegade Monk is carefully crafted by Marcus Fergusson using milk from Bruton Organic Dairy and ale from the Milk Street Brewery in Frome. ../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.identification:
Godminster's Organic Brie
Godminster's Organic Brie is a delicious and high-quality cheese made by skilled artisan cheesemakers Malcolm and Steve Dyer in the beautiful market town of Bruton, Somerset. This cheese is made with fresh organic milk from Godminster Farm, which is located only one mile away from the dairy. With a rich history and a strong geographical provenance, Godminster's Organic Brie is a true testament to the traditional methods of cheese-making.
../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.description: Godminster's Organic Brie is a round-shaped cheese with a creamy and smooth texture. It weighs approximately 250 grams and is coated with a thin layer of white mold. This cheese is made with organic cow's milk and uses traditional rennet, giving it a unique and authentic flavor.
../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.process: The process of creating Godminster's Organic Brie is a labor of love that takes seven days from start to finish. The milk is collected from Godminster Farm and the cheese is manufactured on the same day, ensuring the freshest possible ingredients. The cheese is then drained overnight, transferred to a drying room for 24 hours, and then placed in ripening rooms for six days. Finally, it is wrapped by hand on the seventh day, ready for sale.
../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.smell_taste: Godminster's Organic Brie has a distinct and inviting smell, with hints of earthy and nutty notes. When at its full maturity, the cheese has a smooth and creamy texture with a rich and buttery taste. As it ages, it becomes more crumbly and tangy, offering a different but equally delicious experience.
../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.service_suggestions: To fully enjoy Godminster's Organic Brie, it is best served at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a perfect appetizer or dessert. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, including apples, pears, and figs. For a complete culinary experience, it is recommended to pair Godminster's Organic Brie with a glass of dry white wine, such as a Sauvignon Blanc or Chardonnay.
../data/rhet_data\\487ChD_181113FoodEN.t.quality_assurance: Godminster's Organic Brie has received numerous accolades and awards, including the prestigious Great Taste Award. It has also been praised by food critics and customers alike, earning rave reviews for its exceptional taste and quality. Characteristics of Blacksticks Blue
Blacksticks Blue is a medium-strength cheese with a creamy texture and a distinctive buttery bite. Its beautiful golden hue is obtained from the use of Annatto, a natural product of a South American shrub. This soft blue cheese is foil-wrapped and weighs approximately 2 months or more.
../data/rhet_data\\506ChD_181217FoodEN.t.process:
The Preparation and Aging Process of Blacksticks Blue
Crafted with care, Blacksticks Blue is made from pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet. The cheese is pierced to create the beautiful blue veins and then aged for a minimum of 2 months. This process gives the cheese its unique flavor and texture.

A Delicious British Cheese
Shropshire Blue, made by renowned Stilton makers Cropwell Bishop, is a cheese with a rich history and a unique geographical provenance. Despite its name, this cheese is not made in Shropshire, but rather in the Stilton producing regions of Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, and Derbyshire. Originally made in Scotland, this cheese has become a beloved British delicacy.
../data/rhet_data\\564ChD_181220FoodEN.t.description:
2) A Cheese with Distinct Characteristics
Shropshire Blue is a visually stunning cheese with its vibrant orange hue, thanks to the addition of natural dye annatto. Its texture is firm, making it perfect for slicing and melting. This cheese is made from pasteurized cow's milk and uses vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians. Each piece weighs 250g, making it an ideal size for sharing.
../data/rhet_data\\564ChD_181220FoodEN.t.process:
The Preparation and Aging Process
The cheesemaking process of Shropshire Blue is a true pleasure to behold. The evening and morning milk are combined before adding the starter culture, rennet, and penicillium roqueforti, which gives the cheese its distinctive blue veining. After the curds form, they are drained, milled, and salted before being hand-ladled into their molds. The cheese is then aged for a total of 5 weeks, allowing the blue veining to develop and the flavors to mature.
../data/rhet_data\\564ChD_181220FoodEN.t.smell_taste:

Its aroma is equally enticing, with a rich and earthy scent that will awaken your taste buds.

This cheese also pairs well with honey, macadamia nuts, and a port dressing in a salad. For the perfect accompaniment, enjoy it with a glass of full-bodied red wine.
